results.title: Suspect in Maine Shooting Is Found Dead, Ending Sprawling Manhunt
results.abstract: The body of the man suspected of killing 18 and injuring 13 others in Lewiston was found with an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound late Friday.

media.caption: A law enforcement helicopter circles over a property in Bowdoin, Maine, where a suspect was believed to be.
media.copyright: Andrew Cullen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Race and Ethnicity;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Johnson, Mike (1972- )
results.title: On Race, Mike Johnson Says His Views Were Shaped by Raising a Black Child
results.abstract: The new House speaker has kept his oldest son out of the public eye — except when the Republican talks about race.

media.caption: House Speaker Mike Johnson faces new scrutiny for his comments on race, which have sometimes included mention of his son Michael, whom Mr. Johnson says he took in 24 years ago and raised with his wife, Kelly.

results.title: Gunman in Maine Mass Shooting Had Paranoid Beliefs, Officials Say
results.abstract: The man was found dead on Friday night, ending a two-day manhunt. The police said he had legally purchased several guns, including in recent days.

results.title: Yoko Ono and the Women of Fluxus Changed the Rules in Art and Life
results.abstract: A show at the Japan Society focuses on four innovators who created a blueprint for a new society with postcards, scissors, chess sets and instructions.

media.caption: From an exhibition at the Japan Society, Yoko Ono performing “Cut Piece” at Carnegie Recital Hall, New York City, March 1965, in which audience members were invited up to snip off her clothing.

results.title: U.A.W. Reaches Tentative Deal With Stellantis, Following Ford
results.abstract: The United Automobile Workers union announced the deal with Stellantis, the parent of Chrysler, Jeep and Ram. It also expanded its strike against G.M.

media.caption: Striking workers outside the Stellantis plant in Toledo, Ohio, earlier this week. The strike has halted the production of Jeep Wranglers and Jeep Gladiators at the plant.

results.adx_keywords: Birth Rates;Population;Youth;Culture (Arts);Economic Conditions and Trends;Politics and Government;vis-photo;vis-design;Africa
results.byline: By Declan Walsh and Hannah Reyes Morales
results.title: The World Is Becoming More African
results.abstract: Africa has the fastest growing, youngest population of any continent. By 2050, one in four people on the planet will be African. Early tremors of this seismic change are already registering around the world.

media.caption: As the world grays, Africa blooms with youth.
media.copyright: Hannah Reyes Morales for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Magazines;Appointments and Executive Changes;Art;Collectors and Collections;Boycotts;Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Velasco, David;Artforum
results.title: Artists Call for Boycott After Artforum Fires Its Top Editor
results.abstract: Several artists have said they will stop working with the magazine after its response to an open letter that called for Palestinian liberation and a cease-fire.

media.caption: “I have never lived through a more chilling period,” said the artist Nan Goldin, who signed the open letter published on Artforum. “People are being blacklisted. People are losing their jobs.”

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);United States Politics and Government;Pence, Mike;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Lisa Lerer and Rebecca Davis O’Brien
results.title: Pence Bows Out of 2024 Presidential Race That Trump Is Dominating
results.abstract: The former vice president said he would end his bid in a surprise announcement at a gathering of Jewish Republican donors. “It’s become clear to me that this is not my time,” he said.

media.caption: Mike Pence, vice president under Donald J. Trump, sought to portray himself in the mold of Ronald Reagan, but Trump-era Republicans showed little interest.

results.title: This Is What Keeps My Eco-Anxiety in Check
results.abstract: The simple act of picking up trash, I’ve found, has an outsize effect on my worrying over climate change and ecological catastrophe.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Flowers and Plants;Content Type: Service;Insects;Butterflies and Moths
results.title: If You Plant Milkweed, They Will Come. (And Not Just the Butterflies.)
results.abstract: These underappreciated plants attract a “hungry throng” of beneficial insects. They’re not bad to look at, either.

media.caption: Common milkweed (Asclepias syriaca), the most widespread milkweed east of the Rocky Mountains, can colonize disturbed sites. But most of the more than 90 recognized North American species have a harder time making themselves at home.
media.copyright: Illustration by Beverly Duncan, from “The Milkweed Lands” by Eric Lee-Mäder, used with permission from Storey Publishing

results.adx_keywords: Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Bridges and Tunnels;Terrorism;Defense and Military Forces;Kidnapping and Hostages;Palestinians;Netanyahu, Benjamin;Hamas;Egypt;Gaza Strip;Israel
results.byline: By Adam Goldman, Helene Cooper and Justin Scheck
results.title: Gaza’s Tunnels Loom Large for Israel’s Ground Forces
results.abstract: Hamas is believed to hide weapons, fighters and even command centers in miles of subterranean pathways and chambers.

media.caption: A Palestinian fighter of the Al-Quds brigade in a military tunnel in the northern Gaza Strip last year. Hamas has developed a network of subterranean fighting positions snaking underneath the enclave.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Museums;Travel and Vacations;Tombs and Tombstones;Buonarroti, Michelangelo;Medici Family;Florence (Italy)
results.title: Are ‘Secret Room’ Drawings by Michelangelo? Now, Visitors Can Judge for Themselves.
results.abstract: Since its discovery nearly 50 years ago, a room beneath the Medici Chapels in Florence covered in sketches has been closed to the public. Next month, that will change.

media.caption: Francesca de Luca, the director of the museum at the Medici Chapels, inside the stanza segreta, or secret room, where she noted similarities between the drawings on the wall and the work of Michelangelo.
media.copyright: Clara Vannucci for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Television;Comedy and Humor;Moll, Richard (1943-2023)
results.title: Richard Moll, Towering Bailiff on ‘Night Court,’ Dies at 80
results.abstract: His career spanned more than four decades, but he was best known for playing the imposing but lovable Bull Shannon on the long-running NBC sitcom.

media.caption: Richard Moll, right, as the bailiff Bull Shannon in a 1991 episode of the sitcom “Night Court.” Also pictured are, from left, Charles Robinson as the court clerk Mac, Cathy McAuley as Bull’s bride-to-be and Paddi Edwards as Bull’s mother.
media.copyright: Alice S. Hall/NBC, via Getty Images
